job_title: Digital Marketing Specialist in Chicago, IL
pros: It is a great place to showcase your skills and educate others on your specialty. You can grow your skillset and learn through various tools and opportunities at your own pace. Your colleagues respect your recommendations and your knowledge which is very refreshing. There is a great amount of time off and work-life balance is something that everyone respects and knows the meaning of.
cons: There is a yearly raise that is set by the union, it is no more than 4% each year.

pros: The students are wonderful to work with.
cons: Some deans are awful and incompetent.

job_title: Director of Content and Creative in Elgin, IL
pros: People genuinely enjoy working at ECC and with their colleagues. People are excited to come to work and employees care about students and the institution.
cons: The challenges of an institution like ECC can be the red tape and the number of people that need to provide input. These decisions and this feedback can sometimes affect the original goal or slow down the process, or both.

pros: Nice people, lots of benefits and time off.
cons: Tough management, lots of turn over.

pros: People are nice and love working with the students
cons: The organization is in disarray - too many chiefs..

pros: The people really care about serving students.
cons: Not embracing hybrid work for staff.

pros: ECC has better pay than most colleges for adjuncts and you can work within a union which gives you some benefits. They also respect their adjuncts and respects their thoughts. It feels like a team.
cons: They tend to think that adjuncts can't teach and full-timers can when that isn't always true. They will offer so many resources to help instruction but it often geared and pushed towards the adjuncts and not the full timers as well.

pros: Great Facilities and Fridays off in the summer.
cons: Political environment for promotions or positions

pros: Overall good job while going to school, pay is not great but get able to focus on college courses
cons: pay is not the best

pros:
Friendly staff

great campus

job_title: In Class Aide in Carpentersville, IL
pros:
- Excellent boss (Pietrina Probst, Disability Services).
- Wonderful on-the-job experience.
- Healthy work environment.
- Creative work that pushes the employee's initiative.
cons:
- Low pay rate ($10/hr).
- Limited work hours and no off-season work for students.

pros: I taught the College Success Course part time at ECC for three years.  I loved this experience due to the students and content.
cons:
The big concern I had was when a counselor addressed my class about the counseling services. 
Her first question was, “How many of you have been to the counseling center?”  So a few raised their hands.  Her question concerned me, as it violated confidentiality.  As a counselor myself, I’m well aware of that professional ethic.
She then continued, “What did you go there for?”  
I jumped in with both feet, and said, “I’ve already told my students that what happens at the counseling center is totally confidential, as allowed by law.  I consider them free to avoid that question.”  So she skipped it and went on.
I later emailed the Assistant Dean of Counseling, and gently told him about that scenario, and suggested a mild talk to her about it.
His response to me was a one sentence defense of her action, starting with the phrase, “She probably…”
I lost my position the next semester, supposedly because of negative student evaluations, which I knew didn’t take place, as I read them.  I even had a student who picked me as an instructor because she asked around first to find out who the good teachers were.
So he defended unethical behavior, and didn’t appreciate feedback about it.  What does that say?

job_title: Testing & Data Specialist in Elgin, IL
pros: Great team work!! Job Flexibility.
cons: Low pay rates. Less opportunity for full time work.

pros: In light of all the things that cause a great deal of stress, failure, infra-fighting, unhappiness, and delivering poor products, the college hangs on to old ways of doing business when jobs were secure, the school made money, employees were a caring community. The employees are in a state of perpetual denial, which actually makes it a nice environment for students. There are much worse places to work. ECC has, at the very least, its union contracts (unfortunately it desperately needs them).
cons:
#1 problem is lack of resources
There are not enough qualified people in management
Hiring process is a joke
Personal and political agendas dominate—partly due to lack of upward mobility, and partly due to greedy upper management and those who have been there too long. You must be aggressive and take advantage of people to get anywhere.
Inability to adapt and change to meet current needs/trends of students today (very common now in colleges)
Poor quality control
Systemic problems and errors remain unresolved
Needs of employees are poorly addressed causing much angst.
Siloed environment results in poor communication and extreme inefficiency (lots of waster here).

pros: A lot of paid time off, good insurance
cons: Relationship management needs some work

pros:
Fair Payment 
Friendly Co-Workers
Good Management
cons:
Some occasional downtime
Non-Paid break
Long Hours

review_title: Environment with much turmoil and very little change
pros: Tuition reimbursement, benefits were outstanding and fridays off in the summer were wonderful.
cons: No one gets fired for the most part in these union environments so the staff are crabby, territorial and set in their ways.  People talk very harshly to each other and I felt like I worked with a lot of instability.  It seems like no matter what the situation if you confront this behavior it will just get turned on you.  Better to talk to no one and keep your head down....which is sad, not really my dream work environment.

pros: Beautiful library. And the students were fun to help, they were usually very appreciative as well.  I really liked my fellow librarians, but as a part time employee I didn't see them much.
cons: As a part time librarian I felt very disconnected from the rest of the staff. It was impossible to join committees and feel involved unless I came in on my hours/days off. The atmosphere (at the time) was clique-ish & and it seemed like the older librarians were resistant to change, particularly in realms of technology and added customer service.

review_title: Federal work study program student worker in the Office of Student Life and First Year Programs
pros: Working with all the clubs is very rewarding. Helping students engage outside of the classroom has a huge impact on their likely hood of finishing their degree. There are plenty of routines like making IDs and doing posters, but there is always something new as well.
cons: Well, about the only thing I can really put here is the pay. Minnimum wage sucks. The amount of hours they can give you us based of your financial aid needs, but you still will only make $8.25

pros: Wonderful company. The assistant director and director of the financial aid department are amazing, understanding and when there is a complaint they talk to you first. The president would come down once a week to say hi and remembered everyone's name.
cons: The students can be very rude when it comes to federal aid and are a lot to handle. The HR department is slow and really difficult to work with.

review_title: Great Place to work for students seeking to gain a little experience.
pros: Working at Elgin Community College is great for young people who would like to obtain an associate degree or take some classes while being employed part-time. ECC is a great diverse establishment.
cons: The pay for students is minimum wage which doesn't really help if you have lots of expenses to pay off.

job_title: Adjunct GED Instructor in Elgin, IL
pros: Adjunct staff and administration very supportive.  Departmental administration tries very hard to get to know instructors, they are very organized and supportive.  Since this is a grant funded department, they have to have their act together to keep our department within the required standards to continue our funding, god bless them!!  The Union is wonderful as they have provided a contract with structured pay increases and protection for instructors for number of credit hours and classes, tuition reimbursement for family members a big plus, not just for the instructor, professional development funds.
cons: No health insurance for adjuncts

pros: ECC makes an effort to have strong teaching, so it's a great place to be an instructor. The Center for Enhancement of Teaching and Learning offers lots of opportunities for professional growth.
cons: Low pay for adjuncts, but on par with what other colleges pay

pros: Good Benefits and pay was appropriate.  Fridays off were nice and lots of opportunities for education and training
cons: Very under qualified people for the positions they held.  Seemed as if many could use counseling, very negative environment filled with jealousy and secrets filled with competition.  Seems like managers are allowed to do what they please at will, even if it is mutually agreed upon that their methods are poor, nothing seems to resolve itself.  No one gets fired.

review_title: Great institution, proud to be affiliated with ECC as an adjunct
pros: Love the independence and the respect shown to adjuncts. Facilities are wonderful.
cons:
Pay is poor until you reach the status of adjunct II and then it is better.  It is hard to be a new adjunct as you are on your own to figure out all the processes.  There are resources available but basically you are training yourself.
Limited opportunities for non PhD adjuncts.

review_title: Great place to work if you want to make a difference in the incoming workforce. One of the Best kept secrets in the area
pros: Always something interesting going on in campus activities, different programs, nice extras as far as cafeteria, discounts on theatre, you can earn credits to take free classes and more.
cons: It takes forever for the recruiting process!

review_title: Low pay, but good atmosphere with little job challenges
pros:
-Very professional and welcoming environment
-Great employment opportunities for the Elgin area
-great benefits and can take classes for free if full time.
-Good people.
cons:
-Low pay, especially for junior staff and student workers
-Lots of meetings and mandatory seminars
-Very little chance for advancement
-Teachers can be very demanding

pros: This is what dreams are made of.  A workplace where you are a valued professional.  A management team with consideration for all team members.  An executive administrator that is nothing but transparent.
cons: Difficult to move from PT to FT, especially for adjunct instructors.

pros: i worked there for the students success and challenges. Many people stay employed for over 20 years. Great comrade tie in many departments. Phenomenal President, Dr.Sam with and incredible foundation and board of Directors. They truly care
cons: limited advancement opportunities. Takes a long time to get hired, very political

pros: CoWorks in general are good to work with!
cons: No promotions for people with in, there are asked to take a lesser pay then people who are hired from the outside! Then current works are ask to train them for a job you could have done better with the knowledge and experience you have for the same job!

pros: Fantastic benefits, so much so that people who should leave stay, they've outlived their usefulness to the org, they linger on being unproductive.
cons: HR is the worst, takes forever to get people hired, too much dependance on group interviews, hiring cmte's bias. They change HR Directors every 2 years, so lacks any consistent direction. President has too much control, the board is asleep at the wheel.  Awful for a public institution, they'd never survive if they were a for profit organization.

review_title: It was a great experience working for Elgin Community College
job_title: Computer Lab Aide in Elgin, IL
pros: Good environment, great people to work with. Never a dull moment when working with all of the students and staff
cons: Some times higher up employees would be busy when an issue need to be escalated. Students sometimes demanded help instead of asked for it

job_title: Food Service Cashier in Melrose Park, IL
pros: The people at this school are amazing. I worked in the cafeteria/coffee shop/juice bar. I got to know the staff from seeing them come to my register every day. Plus, seeing the kids every day and see how they progress is a definite perk to this job.
cons: The department I worked in got a bit hectic and somewhat disorganized at times.

pros: Working with young, energetic minds in the area of Social behavior.  I also enjoy teaching others, and exploring the field of Sociology and how it relates to every day Genres.
cons: It's funny, students are like children, they believe themselves to be smarter than their teacher,  experts at plagiarizing! LOL

pros: Really grew as a public speaker. We have training before the start of orientations to prepare us to speak as well as team building exercises to get to know each other. I absolutely despise team building exercises, but the new hirees were hilarious and fun to be around.
cons: Pays minimum wage for student workers.

review_title: It is a very good place to work long time
pros: Education is a good career.
cons: People work here are protected by union. It is hard to see the outstanding people to get good raise.

pros: Flexible hours, nice as a supplementary income for a grad student, students are overall good to work with, friendly co-workers

pros: The people there are great to work with and will go out of their way to help you.

pros: great benefits - that's it

pros: Great Daycare facility and flexible hours
cons: Big place, could work better on communication and leadership.

pros: Great people to work with, there's a sense of community. Everyone is so friendly.

review_title: ECC is a great place to work :)
pros: ECC made the on-baording process easy. Love what I do!
cons: The only con I can think of is the distance from the City.

pros: Pay is good, you have a union to negotiate your contract. Very nice colleagues. Beautiful campus with good technology.
cons: No health insurance if you're adjunct.
